newsitem.title: ITALY: Olivetti sees net fin requirement falling.
newsitem.headline: Olivetti sees net fin requirement falling.

text.p: Italy's Olivetti said on Thursday its total net financial requirement will fall to 2.60 trillion lire at June 30 and then fall to 2.20 trillion lire by the end of the year.
Group chief executive Roberto Colaninno told an analysts meeting: "We think we will close 1997 with a net financial requirement similar to that at the end-1996 of 2.20 trillion."
The group's net financial requirement at end-March 1997 was 2.700 trillion lire.

The rise in the net financial requirement in the first quarter of 1997 included 70 billion lire for start-up costs at Infostrada, 80 billion lire in the PC sector, 50 billion lire extraordinary costs for Omnitel and 300 billion lire on the reduction of debts to suppliers, Colaninno said.
